Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sith \Sith\, Sithe \Sithe\, n. [AS. ??? a path, way, time, occasion.] Time. [Obs.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
And humbly thanked him a thousand sithes. --Spenser. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sith \Sith\, prep., adv., & conj. [See {Since}.] Since; afterwards; seeing that. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
We need not fear them, sith Christ is with us. --Latimer. [1913 Webster]
Sith thou art rightful judge. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
